Description: Broken upper border of a Book of the Dead papyrus of late 17th or early 18th Dynasty (dated palaeographically). Frame 2 consists of small unplaced fragments.
Dimensions: Width: 73.50 centimetres (main sequence of fragments as mounted after conservation following unrolling)
Curator's comments: Resembles BM EA 10475 in date and condition. Palaeographically the manuscript seems earlier than the reign of Hatshepsut to which the oldest securely dated Book of the Dead on papyrus belongs (Cairo MSS of Hatnefer, mother of Senenmut). The order of chapters recalls that in pMesemnetjer, BD 71 ... 124-83 to 85-64-91, and 39-65-95-104-116-91.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134633) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134633)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus, black inkMount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A
